title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for y = -1

1 point is earned if substitutes y = -1 into the equation of the curve

1 point is earned for the answer

Vertical tangent lines occur at points on the curve where y 3 +1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3975@ =0 (or y=-1) and x≠−1.

On the curve, y=-1 implies that x 2 +2x+1−4=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8C@ , so x=-4 or x=2. Vertical tangent lines occur at the points (-4, -1) and (2,-1).
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for y=-1

1 point is earned if substitutes y=-1 into the equation of the curve

1 point is earned for the answer

Vertical tangent lines occur at points on the curve where y 3 +1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3975@ =0 (or y=-1) and x≠−1.

On the curve, y=-1 implies that x 2 +2x+1−4=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8C@ , so x=-4 or x=2. Vertical tangent lines occur at the points (-4, -1) and (2,-1).

The student response earns one of the following points:

1 point is earned for y=-1

1 point is earned if substitutes y=-1 into the equation of the curve

1 point is earned for the answer

Vertical tangent lines occur at points on the curve where y 3 +1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3975@ =0 (or y=-1) and x≠−1.

On the curve, y=-1 implies that x 2 +2x+1−4=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8C@ , so x=-4 or x=2. Vertical tangent lines occur at the points (-4, -1) and (2,-1).

The student response earns two of the following points:

1 point is earned for y=-1

1 point is earned if substitutes y=-1 into the equation of the curve

1 point is earned for the answer

Vertical tangent lines occur at points on the curve where y 3 +1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3975@ =0 (or y=-1) and x≠−1.

On the curve, y=-1 implies that x 2 +2x+1−4=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8C@ , so x=-4 or x=2. Vertical tangent lines occur at the points (-4, -1) and (2,-1).

The student response earns all of the following points:

1 point is earned for y=-1

1 point is earned if substitutes y=-1 into the equation of the curve

1 point is earned for the answer

Vertical tangent lines occur at points on the curve where y 3 +1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3975@ =0 (or y=-1) and x≠−1.

On the curve, y=-1 implies that x 2 +2x+1−4=5 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F8C@ , so x=-4 or x=2. Vertical tangent lines occur at the points (-4, -1) and (2,-1).
